page.title: 12LONGTON'S - PUBLIC HOUSES
page.content: IN LONGTON village the first of six public houses is the {RAM'S HEAD. It started as a farmhouse which sold drinks and has now become an eating house; a favourite place for a game of pool and to listen to pop records with video. The next pub is a recently converted{MANSION HOUSE}which boasts a pup, a wine bar and a carvery. This tries to be a bit up-market. A very popular{BLACK BULL}displays photogaphs of 1869 when there was a blacksmiths shop attached, and it has a large upper bay-window which is said to be one of the largest in existence.It is the only establishment where you can hire a private room.* The other three pubs are out to the west of our area. The {FARMERS ARMS}at Whitestake (near New Longton) is well known for good food and is very popular ( *{RED {LION; GOLDEN BALL; DOLPHIN})
